TopicTitle: Which (dwarf)planet do you find most interesting?

Articles.Content: I was wondering what everyone thought of the various planets and dwarf planets in the game and which you find most interesting.

Correct me if I'm wrong, but would'nt these planetary analogs be: Moho, Eve, Kerbin, Duna, (possibly Dres) are terrestrial, and (possibly Dres), Jool, and (possibly) Eeloo are Jovian? (Eeloo and Dres may be the only two dwarf planets).

Its (dwarf)planets so that people don't start telling me that Eeloo and Dres are actually dwarf planets and not planets. So that's why I chose (dwarf)planets, so that it encapsulates both planets and dwarf planets.
Dres, easily. At a glance, it seems like it's just Mun Mk. 2. But when you actually get there and take a good look at it, you realize that it's actually a whole lot more interesting than the Mun.

Moho IMO is a very interesting place. The hole is very interesting. It's a extinct place, no geological activity. But maybe in the future it will be much more fun to go to.

EDIT: Why is Duna so interesting? We've all been there like 100 times and it should start getting very boring by now.
Kerbin is the most interesting, simply because it is the most detailed.
No love for Eve? I guess I'll be the first then!

No love for Eve? I guess I'll be the first then!

psssst : (all the guys that love Eve are still on it, cause it's pretty darn hard to come back from it )

Dres. Even though ive never laid eyes on it in game its the most interesting planet to me. Its so isolated and tiny that just wants to be visited. Also nobody ever visits it so it has an awesome sense of mystery. Yahh Dres is awesome.
Definitely Moho. Fun (!) to get to, great gravity, interrupting color, great view of the sun, mountains and craters, the Mohole, and a fantastic place for rovers.
YEAH, finally some appreciation for Dres! Dres is awesome but lonely. It would be cool to have some super low orbiting moons around Dres.

Its (dwarf)planets so that people don't start telling me that Eeloo and Dres are actually dwarf planets and not planets. So that's why I chose (dwarf)planets, so that it encapsulates both planets and dwarf planets.

Ah, I see. My bad!

Dres. Even though ive never laid eyes on it in game its the most interesting planet to me. Its so isolated and tiny that just wants to be visited. Also nobody ever visits it so it has an awesome sense of mystery. Yahh Dres is awesome.

No one has ever visted Dres: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114169-This-is-why-no-one-visits-Dres

"Some people do claim to have visited it, perhaps even multiple times. But those people are lying."

Edited April 21, 2015 by JedTech

Oops, i accidentally clicked Dres. My computer crashed instantaneously, my ipad overheated, my TV turned to static, and my lamp burned out. When i tried to turn on my computer again, it took 5 hours, and when i tried to click Dres again, my intercom turned on and said "I'm sorry Will, but I can't let you do that.
Jool, cause moons. I sometimes wish it were closer to Kerbin, but getting there's half the fun of it.
voted for eeloo, mainly because I've never been there so it's all mysterious to me.

Is it just me, or does this same poll get re-hashed once a month? Not criticizing or anything, just an observation.

Anyway, I voted Eve because it's a challenge to return from. My first successful return mission there required a long rover trek as well in order to gather science from both land and water, and so I got to see a lot of the landscape. Heck, just getting down a hill in a rover can be a challenge on that planet -- overspeed and then flip and explode! I have fond memories of blasting my favorite music CD while driving 9km to the awaiting launch vehicle on 3x phys warp.

The color palette needs some work, though.

My main focus before installing the 6.4x mod was Jool and Duna. They're great places, although I used to also show some interest in Dres.

But now things are different and I'm still trying to make a suitable ship to land a kerbal on the Mun and come back home.
All about Jool. It's just so dang fun slingshotting things around that crazy mess of SoIs.
I was stupid to give Dres a sympathy vote before reading the thread... xP
I love Eve, Easy to get to and you can sail a boat!
I like Eve... but I've never put a kerbal on it for fear of inability to get back

I like Eve... but I've never put a kerbal on it for fear of inability to get back

Don't worry, bro. I'm right there with ya, except I use Kethane to leave.
I voted Dres, gotta give that lump of rock some love

On the dwarf planet issue, TBH I'm not sure if Dres would be considered one. While small, Dres ATM it is the dominant body in his orbit around The Sun ( yeah, The Sun, not Kerbol. Check your game before trying to correct me ) so it would probably be considered a bona fide planet by current rules. Eeloo OTOH would be a dwarf planet without doubt , for the same reasons

On topic, Definitely Kerbin. Kerbin has a wide range of landscapes , the biggest of any body in the The Sun system ( yeah, that is well written ) and some of them are simply breathtaking even in stock . Too bad that most players simply want to get out of it ASAP
